[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Network] [Connection Pooling] Does the reqwest client reuse connections? Can connection pooling issues cause some validators to use stale HTTP connections that serve outdated JWKs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Resources] [Memory Growth] If JWK sets grow unbounded over time, does this cause memory issues? Are there limits on JWK set sizes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Resources] [HTTP Client Cleanup] Is the reqwest client in fetch_jwks_from_jwks_uri properly cleaned up after each request, or do long-running observers accumulate connection handles? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Resources] [Tokio Runtime] Does spawning many JWKObserver instances exhaust tokio runtime threads? Can this degrade validator performance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Configuration] [Fetch Interval Bounds] Is there a minimum/maximum limit on fetch_interval? Can an attacker set fetch_interval to 0 or Duration::MAX causing issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Configuration] [URL Scheme Validation] Does spawn() validate that config_url uses HTTPS? Can HTTP URLs be used, making JWK fetches vulnerable to MitM attacks? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Configuration] [Issuer Uniqueness] Are issuer strings validated for uniqueness across all spawned observers? Can duplicate issuers cause conflicts in JWK consensus? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Cryptographic] [JWK Key Strength] Does the system validate that fetched JWKs meet minimum cryptographic strength requirements (e.g., RSA key size >= 2048 bits)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Cryptographic] [Algorithm Support] Can an attacker include JWKs with weak or deprecated algorithms that are still accepted by the system? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Cryptographic] [Key ID Collisions] If two different JWKs have the same kid (key ID), how is this handled after sorting? Can this cause key confusion in keyless verification? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Error Handling] [Partial Failures] If fetch_jwks_uri_from_openid_config succeeds but fetch_jwks_from_jwks_uri fails, is the failure properly categorized? Can this leak information about validator network configuration? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Error Handling] [Retry Logic] There is no retry logic for failed fetches. Can transient network issues cause validators to permanently miss JWK updates, leading to consensus divergence? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Error Handling] [Error Flooding] If fetch_jwks consistently fails, does the error logging with debug! cause log flooding that hides other critical security events? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Logging] [Sensitive Data] Does the debug! logging at line 75 accidentally log sensitive data from fetched JWKs? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Logging] [Log Injection] Can malicious issuer or config_url strings contain newlines or control characters that cause log injection attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Logging] [Timing Correlation] Can the combination of spawn logging (line 39-44) and observation metrics be used to correlate validator identities with network traffic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Protocol] [OpenID Compliance] Does fetch_jwks_uri_from_openid_config validate that the OpenID configuration response conforms to the OpenID Connect Discovery 1.0 specification? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Protocol] [JWK Set Validation] Does the system validate that the fetched JWK set conforms to RFC 7517 (JSON Web Key)? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Protocol] [Content-Type Validation] Are the Content-Type headers of OpenID config and JWKs responses validated? Can an attacker serve non-JSON responses that cause parsing errors? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [State] [Observer Lifecycle] Who is responsible for calling shutdown()? Can forgotten observers continue running indefinitely, accumulating in memory? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [State] [Epoch Coordination] How does the epoch parameter coordinate with the actual consensus epoch? Can epoch mismatches cause JWK observations to be attributed to wrong epochs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [State] [Channel Backpressure] If the observation_tx channel fills up, does push() block or drop messages? Can slow JWK consensus processing create backpressure that delays observations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Attack Scenario] [Consensus Split] Can an attacker who controls an OIDC provider serve different JWK sets to different validators based on source IP, causing a consensus split where validators cannot agree on observed JWKs, halting JWK consensus and breaking keyless authentication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Attack Scenario] [Time-of-Check-Time-of-Use] Can an attacker exploit the two-step fetch process (OpenID config -> JWKs URI) by changing the JWKs between the two requests, causing validators to fetch from an attacker-controlled endpoint? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-jwk-consensus/src/jwk_observer.rs] [Attack Scenario] [Validator Fingerprinting] Can an attacker use the smoke-test feature and timing analysis to fingerprint which validators are fetching JWKs, then target specific validators with tailored attacks? (Medium)
